technical-data.invention-title: MASCHINE MIT SENKRECHTEM RAD UND VERFAHREN ZUM FORMPRESSEN VON ABDICHTUNGEN
VERTICAL WHEEL MACHINE AND METHOD FOR COMPRESSION MOLDING SEALING LINERS
MACHINE A ROUE VERTICALE ET PROCEDE DE MOULAGE PAR COMPRESSION DE GARNITURES D'ETANCHEITE

description.p: The present invention is directed to a vertical wheel machine and method for compression molding sealing liners within premade closure shells.

Machines for compression molding sealing liners within closure shells typically include a turret or carousel that rotates around a vertical axis. Machines of that type are illustrated in US-A 3,827,843, US-A 3,439,718 and US-B 5,451,360. A plurality of molds are provided around the periphery of the carousel in the form of male and female mold sections that are aligned along vertical axes parallel to the axis of rotation. Cams drive one or both of the mold sections of each pair between an open position, in which a molded part is removed from the mold and a premade shell and a charge of plastic liner material are placed in the female mold section, and a closed position in which the male and female mold sections are brought together to compression mold the liner within the shell.

GB-A 0502977 discloses a machine for forming receptacle screw caps that comprises a vertical wheel rotating around a horizontal axis and carrying a number of mandrels for rotably supporting each a cap blank. The cap blanks are operated upon by stationary dies to result in screw caps. US 3,210,805 shows a molding machine for plastic packings from plastic tape, the machine comprising a vertical wheel rotating around a horizontal axis. US-A-3655 612 discloses a moulding machine for ecapsulating electronic parts by using moulds rotatable around a horizontal axis. Transferring plungers inject the material into the mould cavity. No moulds for making sealing liners are provided.

Although vertical axis carousel-type machines of the noted type have enjoyed substantial commercial acceptance and success, innovation remains desirable. In particular, in vertical axis carousel-type machines, the weight of the rotating equipment is parallel to the vertical axis of rotation, creating a bending moment with respect to the axis of rotation and the bearings and shaft that support the carousel. Carousel-type machines also require a substantial amount of valuable floor space in a manufacturing facility.

It is a general object of the present invention to provide an apparatus and method for compression molding sealing liners within premade closure shells that reduce the forces applied to the support frame and bearings, and/or reduce maintenance requirements and the amount of energy needed to operate the machine, and/or reduce the amount of floor space required per machine.
The present invention involves a number of aspects that can be implemented separately from or in combination with each other.

An apparatus for compression molding sealing liners in premade closure shells, in accordance with a first aspect of presently preferred embodiments of the invention, includes a shell loader for presenting premade closure shells in sequence, a mold charge placement device for placing charges of liner material into the premade shells, and a vertical wheel molding machine for receiving the closure shells in sequence from the loader and compression molding the mold charges to form sealing liners within the closure shells. The vertical wheel molding machine preferably includes a wheel mounted for rotation around a horizontal axis and a plurality of angularly spaced molds disposed around the wheel. Each of the molds preferably includes a first mold segment and a second mold segment disposed radially outwardly of the first mold segment. One of the first and second mold segments, preferably the second mold segment, is a female mold segment that includes a nest for receiving a premade closure shell. The other of the first and second mold segments, preferably the first mold segment, is a male mold segment that includes a core for engaging and compression molding the mold charge of liner material within the shell. In two disclosed embodiments of the invention, the mold charge of liner material either is placed within the premade closure shell prior to placement of the shell within the nest, or is placed within the shell after placement of the shell in the nest, preferably by placing the mold charge in a pocket on the mold core. The second mold segments preferably are moved radially inwardly and outwardly by at least one cam disposed adjacent to the wheel for engaging the second mold segments as the wheel rotates around its axis.

A method of compression molding sealing liners within premade closure shells, in accordance with another aspect of the invention, includes providing a wheel mounted for rotation around a horizontal axis and a plurality of angularly spaced molds disposed around the wheel. Each of the molds includes a first mold segment and a second mold segment disposed radially outwardly of the first mold segment. As the wheel is rotated around its horizontal axis, the second mold segments are moved in sequence radially with respect to the associated first mold segments between a radially inner closed position and a radially outer open position spaced from the associated first mold segment. With the mold segments in the open position, closure shells with compression molded sealing liners are removed from the mold, and a premade closure shell and mold charge of liner material are placed in the mold. The mold segments are then closed as the wheel rotates to compression mold the mold charge of liner material between the mold segments. In the disclosed embodiments of the invention, the mold charge of liner material is placed into the premade shells either before or after placing the shells into the molds.

FIGS. 1-9 illustrate a presently preferred embodiment of the present invention in the form of a machine 30 for compression molding sealing liners within plastic closure shells. Machine 30 includes a wheel 32 mounted on a shaft 34 (FIG. 1) between spaced supports 36. Shaft 34 is coupled by a pulley 38, a belt 40 and a gear box 42 to a motor 44 for rotating shaft 34 and wheel 32 around a horizontal axis. Other suitable wheel drive means can be employed. Wheel 32 includes a hub (which may be part of shaft 34) and a support 46 (FIGS. 3, 4 and 5) extending radially from the hub. Support 46 in the illustrated embodiment of the invention is in the form of a circular plate 48. Plate 48 has a plurality of radially outwardly opening peripheral pockets 49 in an equally spaced circumferential array. A rod 50 is slidably supported by sleeve bearings 52 within each pocket 49. A pair of cam rollers 54, 55 are rotatably mounted on a shaft 56 at the outer end of each rod 50 and receive lubricant through a fitting 58. Each shaft 56 is carried by a mounting block 62 secured at or adjacent to the outer end of rod 50. A stabilizer bar 60 extends from each mounting block 62 and cooperates with spaced rollers 64, 66 (FIG. 7) on plate 48 for preventing rotation of rod 50 within pocket 49.

A pair of radially spaced external supports 68,70 are provided on support plate 48. As best seen in FIG. 2, supports 68,70 preferably are in the form of respective circumferentially continuous radially inner and outer annular support rings. A plurality of angularly spaced molds 72 are disposed around wheel 32, preferably adjacent to the periphery of the wheel. Each mold 72 includes a radially inner first mold segment 76 and a second mold segment 78 in radially outward alignment with an associated first mold segment 76. In the preferred embodiments of the invention, the radially inner first mold segment 76 is a male mold segment, and the radially outer second mold segment 78 is a female mold segment, although these mold segments could be reversed in accordance with the broadest principles of the present invention. Molds 72 preferably are identical. FIGS. 3 and 4 show mold 72 open, and FIG. 5 shows mold 72 closed.

Referring to FIGS. 3-5, male first mold segment 76 includes a core assembly 80 slidably mounted by a bearing 82 within a corresponding opening in outer support 70. Core assembly 82 includes a core tip 84 mounted on an inner pin 90, which is secured by screws 91 to a core manifold block 92 by springs 93 within pockets on the manifold block. Springs 93 cut through pins 95, which extend through openings in the base of inner pin 90, to engage the edge of collar 86. Pins 88 in collar 86 extend into slots on the skirt of tip 84 to limit outward movement of collar 86 with respect to tip 84. A coolant tube 94 extends from a first coolant fitting 96 on manifold block 92 through the hollow interior of pin 90 to a position adjacent to the inner face of tip 84. Coolant tube 90 is retained between the inner face of tip 84 and a counterbore in the end of pin 90. An annular passage 98, between pin 90 and the outer surface of tube 94, extends to a second coolant fitting 100 on block 92. Thus, coolant may be circulated from fitting 96 through tube 94 to the inner face of tip 84, and thence through passage 98 to fitting 100 (or in the opposite direction). A third fitting 102 (FIG. 6) is carried by manifold block 92 for selectively applying either vacuum or air under pressure through a passage 104 in block 92, through a passage 106 in pin 90, and then between sleeve 86 and tip 84. Fitting 102 may selectively be connected to vacuum for withdrawing air from the mold cavity during the compression molding operation to help reduce the occurrence of bubbles within the liner, and to air under pressure to assist removal of the closure and compression molded liner from the core assembly.

A spring 108 (FIGS. 3, 4 and 18) is disposed between manifold block 92 and support 68 on support plate 48. Spring 108 in the preferred embodiment of the invention includes a coil spring 110 captured in compression between a head 112 and a base 114. Head 112 is adjustable with respect to base 114 by means of a screw 116 for adjusting the force applied by spring 110. Base 114 is mounted on support 68 by means of a screw 118. Head 112 is in abutting engagement with the radially inner end of manifold block 92. A stop 120 is mounted on manifold block 92 for engagement with outer support 72 to form an outer stop to movement of mold core assembly 76 under the force of spring 108. As noted above, female second mold segment 78 is in the form of a nest, in which preformed closure shells 122 are placed on a platform 74 that is carried by block 62. A guide 124 is mounted on platform 74 for holding the shell in position. Guide 124 includes an opening for receiving core assembly 80 of male first mold segment 76 during radial inward motion of female second mold segment 78. Rollers 54, 55 on rod 50 and support block 62 engage cams 126, 128 (FIGS. 1-3 and 5) that are disposed adjacent to the periphery of wheel 32. Cam 126 extends around the periphery of wheel 32 to move female second mold segments to the closed position (FIG. 4) and hold the mold segments closed. Cam 128 is disposed adjacent to the lower portion of wheel 32 to pull second mold segments 78 open. (It will be appreciated that directional words such as "upper" and "lower" are employed by way of description and not limitation with respect to the upright orientation of machine 30 illustrated in FIG. 1. Directional words such as "radially inner" and "radially outer" are employed by way of description and not limitation with respect to the horizontal axis of wheel rotation).

Thus, as wheel 32 rotates in the clockwise direction in FIG. 1, the counterclockwise direction in FIG. 2 and into the page in FIGS. 3, 4 and 5, second mold segments 78 are pulled radially outwardly in sequence by cam 128 engaged with rollers 55, so that the second mold segments are opened radially outwardly with respect to first mold segments 76. With the mold segments open, closure shells 122, with sealing liners compression molded therein, are extracted from second mold segments 78 by a molded part removal device 130 (FIGS. 1, 2 and 8). A premade plastic closure shell is then placed within the nest of second mold segment 78 by a mold charge placement device 132 (FIGS. 1, 2 and 9). In this embodiment of the invention, the sealing liner mold charge is placed within the closure shell prior to placement of the shell into the nest. Continued rotation of wheel 32 functions through rollers 54 and cam 126 to close second mold segments 78 in sequence against first mold segments 76 to compression mold the charge of liner material within the closure shell. Springs 108 function to absorb excess force on first mold segments 76. The molds remain closed for cooling and set-up of the compression molded liner material until the molds are opened by cam 128 and rollers 55 as previously described.

FIG. 8 schematically illustrates an embodiment of molded part removal device 130 in accordance with a presently preferred embodiment of the invention. Device 130 includes a stripper wheel 134 having angularly spaced pockets 136 for receiving closure shells 122 from mold segments 78 as the mold segments pass in sequence with the molds open.

FIG. 9 schematically illustrates one embodiment of mold charge placement device 132 in accordance with the present invention. Device 132 includes a loader/placement wheel 138 having a circumferential array of angularly spaced pockets 140 for receiving premade closure shells in sequence from a shell loader or infeed 141. A series of pins 142 are carried by wheel 138 and extends radially into respective pockets 140. A coil spring 144 is captured in compression between each pin 142 and wheel 138 for biasing the pin radially outwardly (with respect to the axis of wheel 138) into the associated pocket 140. A guide rail 146 surrounds at least a portion of the periphery of wheel 138. Guide rail 146 includes a portion 148 that is linear and tangential to the axis of rotation of wheel 138. A mold charge placement apparatus 150 is disposed adjacent to wheel 138 and guide rail 146 for placing charges of compression moldable resin liner material into each premade closure shell 122 as the closure shell is moved along portion 148 of guide rail 146. Thus, shells 122 are biased by pins 142 and springs 144 into engagement with the inner surface of guide rail 146. The mold charges are placed in the shells in sequence as the shells travel along linear portion 148 for enhanced control of mold charge placement, which preferably is in the center of each closure shell for enhanced flow of material during the compression molding operation. Mold charge placement apparatus may be of any suitable type, such as that disclosed in U.S. Patent 5,603,964 for example. Wheel 134 in FIGS. 2 and 8, and wheel 138 in FIGS. 2 and 9, are rotated in synchronism with rotation of wheel 32 (FIG. 1).

FIG. 10 illustrates a modification to the embodiment of FIGS. 2-5, in which the coil-type springs 108 in FIGS. 2-5 are replaced by gas springs 152, such as nitrogen gas springs. Gas springs 152 can be self-contained, or can be interconnected by passages 154. in inner support 68, with support 68 thus forming a spring gas manifold.

FIGS. 11-22 illustrate a machine 160 for compression molding sealing liners within premade closure shells in accordance with another embodiment of the invention. Machine 160 of FIGS. 11-22 differs from machine 30 of FIGS. 1-9 primarily in that the premade closure shells and the mold charges of liner material are inserted into the molds in sequence when the molds are open. That is, the mold charges are placed within the premade shells after the shells are inserted into the molds, preferably by placing the mold charges into pockets on the faces of the male first mold segments when the mold segments are open. Parts or elements in FIGS. 11-22 (and 23) that are identical or similar to corresponding parts or elements in the embodiment of FIGS. 1-9 (and 10) are indicated by correspondingly identical reference numerals. The description of the embodiments of FIGS. 11-22 and 23 will be addressed primarily to the differences between these embodiments and the embodiments of FIGS. 1-9 and 10.

Machine 160 includes wheel 162 that is rotatable around a horizontal axis. A plurality of molds 164 are disposed around wheel 162, preferably around the periphery of the wheel. Each mold 164 includes a first mold segment 166, preferably a male mold segment, and a second mold segment 78, preferably a female mold segment, disposed radially outwardly of the associated first mold segment 166. Female second mold segments 78 are engaged by cams 126, 128 disposed adjacent to wheel 162 to pull the female mold segments open to remove molded parts and insert shells and mold charges between the mold segments, and to push the female mold segments closed against the male mold segment to compression mold the liners. In machine 160, the molds are opened at the top of the wheel, rather than at the bottom of the wheel in FIGS. 1-9.

Mold segments 166 preferably are identical, and include a mold core assembly 168 slidably mounted on support 70 by bearings 82 and urged radially outwardly by springs 108. Each core assembly 168 includes a central core pin 170 mounted by a plate 171 (FIGS. 12, 13 and 21) within a support cup 172 (FIGS. 12-13 and 20) slidably engaged with bearing 82. A core sleeve 174 (FIGS. 12-14) slidably surrounds core pin 70. Core sleeve 174 is an assembly of an inner tube 176, which has a radially outwardly facing end wall 178, and an outer sleeve 180 that coaxially surrounds inner tube 176 and is secured to the outer periphery of end wall 178.. The inner surface of inner tube 176 is slidably received on core pin 170, while an annular cavity 182 (FIG. 14) is formed between the outer surface of inner tube 176 and the surrounding outer sleeve 180. An intermediate sleeve 184 (FIGS. 12-13 and 19) is mounted to the outwardly flared inner end 186 of inner tube 176, and extends into annular cavity 182 so as to form in assembly an inner annular cavity 188 and an outer annular cavity 190 (FIG. 13).

A manifold block 192 (FIGS. 12-13 and 17) is mounted on the radially inner end of outer sleeve 180. A first fitting 194 is mounted on manifold block 192 in communication with outer annular passage 190. A second fitting 196 is mounted on manifold block 192 in communication with inner annular passage 188. Manifold block 192 is secured to the end of sleeve 180 and is slidable within a support sleeve 207. Support sleeve 207 (FIGS. 12-13 and 16) seats on plate 171 within support cup 172. Thus, coolant may be circulated from fitting 196 to inner annular passage 188 through an opening 198 adjacent to the radially inner end of intermediate sleeve 184, radially outwardly to outer annular passage 190 through passage 188 and a circumferential array of openings 200 at the opposing radially outer end of intermediate sleeve 184, radially inwardly along outer annular passage 190 through an opening 202 at the radially inner end of sleeve 180, and then through manifold block 192 to fitting 194. The flow direction can be reversed. Fittings 194, 196 extend laterally through an elongated opening 197 in support cup 172 to accommodate movement of manifold block 192 within support cup 172.

A first coil spring 204 (FIG. 13) is captured in compression between an outer flange 206 on sleeve 180 and the radially outer edge of support sleeve 207. Core sleeve 174 thus is biased by spring 204 radially outwardly with respect to core pin 170. A second coil spring 208 (FIG. 13) is captured in compression between an outer shoulder on support sleeve 207 and an outer collar 210 (FIGS. 12-13 and 15) surrounding the radially outer end of core sleeve 174. Outer collar thus is biased radially outwardly, with outward movement being limited by a stop ring 211 (FIGS. 12-13 and 22) secured over the end of support cup 172 to complete core assembly 168. When the mold segments are open (FIGS. 12 and 13), a pocket 212 is formed between the end of core pin 170 and surrounding core sleeve 174 urged radially outwardly by spring 204.

A mold charge placement device 214 (FIGS. 11-13) is disposed adj acent to wheel 164 for placing sequential mold charges into sequential pockets 212 as first mold segments 166 pass in sequence adjacent to the placement device. Mold charge placement device 214 is generally of the type disclosed in above-noted U.S. Patent 5,603,964, the disclosure of which is incorporated herein by reference. A wheel 218 is rotatable around a vertical axis in synchronism with rotation of vertical mold wheel 162 and carries one or more nests 216. Nests 216 are connected by passages 220 in wheel 218 for application of vacuum and air under pressure to the interior of the nests. Nests 216 receive and cut mold charges from an extruder nozzle or the like (not shown), and carry the mold charges to a position overlying pockets 212 in mold segments 166 in sequence. At this position, air under pressure is applied to nest 216 so as to discharge the mold charge, illustrated schematically at 222 in FIGS. 12 and 13, into pocket 212. Further rotation of wheel 162 clears pellet placement device 214, and second mold segment 78 is closed over first mold segment 166 by operation of cam 126 as previously described. After full rotation of wheel 164, as previously described, the closure shell with compression molded sealing liner is removed from the mold.
FIG. 23 illustrates a modification to the embodiment of FIGS. 1-22, in which coil-type springs 108 are replaced by gas springs 152, such as nitrogen gas springs.

There thus have been disclosed an apparatus and method for compression molding sealing lines within premade closure shells, which fully satisfy all of the objects and aims previously set forth. The invention has been described in conjunction with several presently preferred embodiments, and a number of additional modifications and variations have been discussed. Other modifications and variations readily will suggest themselves to persons of ordinary skill in the art. The invention is intended to embrace all such modifications and variations as fall within the spirit and broad scope of the appended claims.

claim.claim-text: Vorrichtung zum Formpressen von Abdichtungseinlagen in Verschlusskappen, umfassend: eine Kappenladeeinrichtung (141), um der Reihe nach vorgefertigte Verschlusskappen (122) bereitzustellen, ein Formbeladungs-Anordnungsgerät (132 oder 214), um Formbeladungen aus einem Einlagenmaterial in die vorgefertigten Kappen (122) einzuordnen, und eine Formmaschine, um der Reihe nach Verschlusskappen (122) von der Ladeeinrichtung (141) zu erhalten und um die Formbeladungen formzupressen, um in den Verschlusskappen (122) Abdichtungseinlagen zu bilden, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Formmaschine eine Formmaschine (30 oder 160) mit senkrechtem Rad ist, die Folgendes umfasst: ein Rad, das zur Drehung um eine waagerechte Achse angebracht (32 oder 162) ist, und mehrere winkelig beabstandete Formen (72 oder 164), die um das Rad herum angeordnet sind, wobei jede der Formen (72; 164) einen ersten Formabschnitt (76 oder 166) und einen zweiten Formabschnitt (78), der radial außerhalb des ersten Formabschnitts angeordnet ist, umfasst, wobei einer aus dem ersten und dem zweiten Formabschnitt eine Aufnahme zum Aufnehmen einer vorgefertigten Verschlusskappe (122) umfasst, und der andere aus dem ersten und dem zweiten Formabschnitt einen Kern (80 oder 168) umfasst, um mit einer Formbeladung in der Kappe (122) einzugreifen und sie formzupressen.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 1, umfassend Mittel (126, 128), um die zweiten Formabschnitte (78) der Reihe nach radial einwärts und auswärts zu bewegen, während sich das Rad (32; 162) um seine waagerechte Achse dreht.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 2, wobei die Mittel (126, 128) wenigstens eine Nocke umfassen, die neben dem Rad (32; 162) angeordnet ist, um der Reihe nach mit den zweiten Formabschnitten einzugreifen, während sich das Rad um die Achse dreht.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 1, wobei das Rad (32 oder 162) eine sich radial erstreckende Halterung (46) umfasst, woran die Formen (72; 164) angebracht sind.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 4, wobei die Formen (72 oder 164) neben einem Umfang der Halterung (46) angebracht sind.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 5, wobei die Halterung (46) mehrere winkelig beabstandete Taschen (49), die sich radial nach außen öffnen, umfasst, und wobei die zweiten Formabschnitte (78) an Stangen (50) angebracht sind, die gleitfähig in den Taschen (49) getragen werden.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 4, wobei jeder der ersten Formabschnitte (76 oder 166) zwischen radial beabstandeten inneren und äußeren Halterungen (68, 70) angebracht ist.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 7, wobei jeder der ersten Formabschnitte (76; 166) gleitfähig in der radial äußeren Halterung (70) angebracht ist und durch eine Feder (108 oder 152) mit der radial inneren Halterung (68) gekoppelt ist.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 8, wobei die Feder (108; 152) eine Spiralfeder oder eine Gasfeder umfasst.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 1, wobei die zweiten Formabschnitte (78) die Aufnahmen umfassen und die ersten Formabschnitte (76 oder 166) die Kerne (80 oder 168) umfassen.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 10, wobei das Formbeladungs-Anordnungsgerät (132) Formbeladungen der Reihe nach in die vorgefertigten Verschlusskappen (122) einordnet, bevor die Kappen in die Aufnahmen eingeordnet werden.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 11, wobei das Formbeladungs-Anordnungsgerät (132) Folgendes umfasst: eine Formbeladungs-Anordnungsvorrichtung (150), ein Anordnungsrad (138), das synchron mit der Drehung des senkrechten Rads (32; 162) um die waagerechte Achse um eine senkrechte Achse drehbar ist, wobei das Anordnungsrad (138) umfängliche Taschen (140) aufweist, um die Verschlusskappen (122) der Reihe nach aufzunehmen, eine Führungsschiene (146), die wenigstens einen Teil des Anordnungsrads (138) umgibt, und Federn (144) an dem Anordnungsrad (138), um mit den Kappen (122) in den Taschen (140) einzugreifen und die Kappen (122) gegen die Führungsschiene (146) zu drängen, um die Kappen (122) in Bezug auf die Formbeladungs-Anordnungsvorrichtung (150) anzuordnen.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 12, wobei die Führungsschiene (146) einen Abschnitt (148) umfasst, der geradlinig und zu der senkrechten Achse tangential ist, so dass sich die Kappen (122) entlang des Abschnitts der Führungsschiene neben der Formbeladungs-Anordnungsvorrichtung (150) auf einem geradlinigen Pfad bewegen.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 12, wobei die Federn (144) mit Stiften (142), die durch das Anordnungsrad (138) getragen werden, eingreifen, um die Kappen (122) gegen die Führungsschiene (146) zu drängen.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 10, wobei das Formbeladungs-Anordnungsgerät (214) Formbeladungen der Reihe nach in die vorgefertigten Verschlusskappen (122) einordnet, nachdem die Kappen in die Aufnahmen eingeordnet wurden.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 15, wobei das Formbeladungs-Anordnungsgerät (214) Formbeladungen der Reihe nach auf den Kernen (168) anordnet, wobei die Kerne die Formbeladungen in die vorgefertigten Kappen (122) einordnen, wenn der zweite Formabschnitt (78) und die Aufnahme gegen den Kern (168) geschlossen sind.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 16, wobei jeder der Kerne (168) Folgendes umfasst: einen Kernstift (170), der mit dem Rad (162) gekoppelt ist, eine Kernhülse (174), die den Kernstift umgibt, und eine Feder (204), die die Kernhülse in Bezug auf den Kernstift radial nach außen vorspannt, um zwischen dem Kernstift und der Kernhülse eine Tasche zum Aufnehmen einer Formbeladung zu bilden, wobei das Schließen des zweiten Formabschnitts (78) gegen den ersten Formabschnitt (166) das Bewegen der Kernhülse (174) gegen die Feder (204) bewirkt, um die Tasche zu verkleinern und die Formbeladung formzupressen.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 17, umfassend Mittel (194, 196), um Kühlmittel durch die Kernhülse (174) zu führen, um den Kern (168) zu kühlen.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 18, wobei die Kernhülse (174) einen ringförmigen Kühlmittelhohlraum (182) bildet, wobei der Kern (168) eine Zwischenhülse (184) umfasst, die so positioniert ist, dass der ringförmige Kühlmittelhohlraum (182) in einen inneren und einen äußeren ringförmigen Kühlmittelhohlraum geteilt wird, wobei die Zwischenhülse (184) Durchgänge (198, 200) umfasst, um Kühlmittel zwischen dem inneren und dem äußeren ringförmigen Hohlraum zu transportieren.

Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 1, wobei jeder der Kerne (168) einen Durchgang (104) zum Anlegen eines Vakuums an eine Spitze des Kerns umfasst, um während des Formpressens der Formbeladung Luft zu beseitigen.

Verfahren zum Formpressen von Abdichtungseinlagen in vorgefertigte Verschlusskappen (122), umfassend die folgenden Schritte: (a) Bereitstellen eines Rads (30 oder 160), das zur Drehung um eine waagerechte Achse angebracht ist, und von mehreren winkelig beabstandeten Formen (72 oder 164), die um das Rad herum angeordnet sind, wobei jede der Formen einen ersten Formabschnitt (76 oder 166) und einen zweiten Formabschnitt (78), der radial außerhalb des ersten Formabschnitts angeordnet ist, umfasst, (b) Drehen eines Rads (30; 60) um eine waagerechte Achse, (c) während der Drehung des Rads (30; 160) radiales Bewegen eines jeden der zweiten Formabschnitte (78) der Reihe nach in Bezug auf den zugehörigen ersten Formabschnitt (76; 166) zwischen einer radial inneren geschlossenen Position mit dem ersten Formabschnitt und einer radial äußeren offenen Position, die von dem zugehörigen ersten Formabschnitt beabstandet ist, (d) während sich die Formabschnitte (76, 78; 166) in der offenen Position befinden, Entnehmen einer Verschlusskappe (122) mit einer formgepressten Einlage aus der Form (72; 164) und Einordnen einer vorgefertigten Verschlusskappe (122) und einer Formbeladung aus einem Einlagenmaterial in die Form, und (e) Schließen der Formabschnitte (76, 78; 166), während sich das Rad (30, 160) dreht, um die Formbeladung aus Einlagenmaterial zwischen den Formabschnitten formzupressen.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 21, wobei die Formbeladung aus Einlagenmaterial in Schritt (d) vor dem Einordnen der Verschlusskappen (122) in die Form in die vorgefertigten Verschlusskappen eingeordnet wird.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 21, wobei die Formbeladung aus Einlagenmaterial in Schritt (d) nach dem Einordnen der Verschlusskappe (122) in die Form in die vorgefertigten Verschlusskappe eingeordnet wird.

Apparatus for compression molding sealing liners in closure shells, which includes: a shell loader (141) for presenting premade closure shells (122) in sequence, a mold charge placement device (132 or 214) for placing mold charges of liner material into the premade shells (122, and a molding machine for receiving closure shells (122) in sequence from said loader (141) and for compression molding the mold charges to form sealing liners within the closure shells (122), characterized in that said molding machine is a vertical wheel molding machine (30 or 160) that includes: a wheel mounted (32 or 162) for rotation around a horizontal axis and a plurality of angularly spaced molds (72 or 164) disposed around said wheel, each of said molds (72; 164) including a fist mold segment (76 or 166) and a second mold segment (78) disposed radially outwardly of said first mold segment, one of said first and second mold segments including a nest for receiving a premade closure shell (122), and the other of said first and second mold segments including a core (80 or 168) for engaging and compression molding a mold charge within the shell (122).

The apparatus set forth in claim 1 including means (126, 128) for moving said second mold segments (78) in sequence radially inwardly and outwardly as said wheel (32; 162) rotates around said horizontal axis.

The apparatus set forth in claim 2 wherein said means (126, 128) includes at least one cam disposed adjacent to said wheel (32; 162) for engaging said second mold segments in sequence as said wheel rotates around said axis.
The apparatus set forth in claim 1 wherein said wheel (32 or 162) includes a radially extending support (46) on which said molds (72; 164) are mounted.
The apparatus set forth in claim 4 wherein said molds (72 or 164) are mounted adjacent to a periphery of said support (46).

The apparatus set forth in claim 5 wherein said support (46) includes a plurality of angularly spaced radially outwardly opening pockets (49), and wherein said second mold segments (78) arse mounted on rods (50) slidably carried in said pockets (49).
The apparatus set forth in claim 4 wherein each of said first mold segments (76 or 166) is mounted between radially spaced inner and outer supports (68, 70).

The apparatus set forth in claim 7 wherein each of said first mold segments (76; 166) is slidably mounted in said radially outer support (70) and is coupled by a spring (108 or 152) to said radially inner support (68).
The apparatus set forth in claim 8 wherein said spring (108; 152) comprises a coil spring or a gas spring.
The apparatus set forth in claim 1 wherein said second mold segments (78) include said nests and said first mold segments (76 or 166) include said cores (80 or 168).

The apparatus set forth in claim 10 wherein said mold charge placement device (132) places mold charges into the premade closure shells (122) in sequence prior to placement of the shells into said nests.

The apparatus set forth in claim 11 wherein said mold charge placement device (132) includes: a mold charge placement apparatus (150), a placement wheel (138) rotatable around a vertical axis synchronism with rotation of said vertical wheel (32; 162) around said horizontal axis, said placement wheel (138) having peripheral pockets (140) for receiving the closure shells (122) in sequence, a guide rail (146) surrounding at least a portion of said placement wheel (138), and springs (144) on said placement wheel (138) for engaging shells (122) in said pockets (140) and urging the shells (122) against said guide rail (146) to locate the shells (122) relative to said mold charge placement apparatus (150).

The apparatus set forth in claim 12 wherein said guide rail (146) includes a portion (148) that is linear and tangential to said vertical axis so that the shells (122) travel in a linear path along said portion of said guide rail adjacent to said mold charge placement apparatus (150).
The apparatus set forth in claim 12 wherein said springs (144) engage pins (142) carried by said placement wheel (138) for urging the shells (122) against said guide rail (146).

The apparatus set forth in claim 10 wherein said mold charge placement device (214) places mold charges into the premade closure shells (122) in sequence after placement of the shells into said nests.

The apparatus set forth in claim 15 wherein said mold charge placement device (214) places mold charges onto said cores (168) in sequence, with said cores placing said mold charges into said premade shells (122) when said second mold segment (78) and nest are closed against said core (168).

The apparatus set forth in claim 16 wherein each of said cores (168) includes; a core pin (170) coupled to said wheel (162), a core sleeve (174) surrounding said core pin, and a spring (204) biasing said core sleeve radially outwardly with respect to said core pin to form a pocket between said core pin and said core sleeve for receiving a mold charge, wherein closing of said second mold segment (78) against said first mold segment (166) effects moving said core sleeve (174) against said spring (204) to reduce said pocket and compression mold the mold charge.
The apparatus set forth in claim 17 including means (194, 196) for directing coolant through said core sleeve (174) to cool said core (168).

The apparatus set forth in claim 18 wherein said core sleeve (174) forms an annular coolant cavity (182), wherein said core (168) includes an intermediate sleeve (184) positioned to divide said annular coolant cavity (182) into inner and outer annular coolant cavities, said intermediate sleeve (184) including passages (198, 200) for feeding coolant between said inner and outer annular cavities.

The apparatus set forth in claim 1 wherein each of said cores (168) includes a passage (104) for application of vacuum at a tip of said core to remove air during compression molding of the mold charge.

A method of compression molding sealing liners within premade closure shells (122), which includes the steps of: (a) providing a wheel (30 or 160) mounted for rotation around a horizontal axis and a plurality of angularly spaced molds (72 or 164) disposed around said wheel, each of said molds including a first mold segment (76 or 166) and a second mold segment (78) disposed radially outwardly of said first mold segment, (b) rotating a wheel (30; 60) around a horizontal axis, (c) as said wheel (30; 60) rotates, radially moving each of said second mold segments (78)_ in sequence with respect to the associated first mold segment (76; 166) between a radially inner closed position with said first mold segment and a radially outer open position spaced from the associated first mold segment, (d) with said mold segments (76, 78; 166) in said open position, removing a closure shell (122) with compression molded liner from said mold (72; 164), and placing a premade closure shell (122) and a mold charge of liner material into said mold, and (e) closing said mold segments (76, 78; 166) as said wheel (30, 160) rotates to compression mold the mold charge of liner material between said mold segments.
The method set forth in claim 21 wherein said mold charge of liner material is placed into the premade closure shells (122) in said step (d) prior to placing the closure shells into said mold.
The method set forth in claim 21 wherein the mold charge of liner material is placed into the premade closure shell (122) in said step (d) after placing the closure shell into said mold.

Dispositif pour le moulage par compression de garnitures d'étanchéité dans des capsules de fermeture, qui comprend: - un chargeur de capsules (141) destiné à présenter en séquence des capsules de fermeture préfabriquées (122), - un dispositif de placement de charge de moule (132 ou 214) destiné à placer des charges de moule de matière de garniture dans les capsules préfabriquées (122), et - une machine de moulage destinée à recevoir des capsules de fermeture (122) en séquence à partir dudit chargeur (141) et à mouler par compression les charges de moule afin de former des garnitures d'étanchéité à l'intérieur des capsules de fermeture (122), caractérisé en ce que - ladite machine de moulage est une machine de moulage à roue verticale (30 ou 160), qui comprend: - une roue (32 ou 162) montée en vue de la rotation autour d'un axe horizontal et une multiplicité de moules (72 ou 164) angulairement espacés disposés autour de ladite roue, - chacun desdits moules (72; 164) comprenant un premier segment de moule (76 ou 166) et un deuxième segment de moule (78) disposé radialement à l'extérieur dudit premier segment de moule, - un desdits premier et deuxième segments de moule présentant une alvéole destinée à recevoir une capsule de fermeture préfabriquée (122), et l'autre desdits premier et deuxième segments de moule présentant un noyau (80 ou 168) destiné à engager et à mouler par compression une charge de moule à l'intérieur de la capsule (122).

Dispositif selon la revendication 1, comportant des moyens (126, 128) pour déplacer lesdits deuxièmes segments de moule (78) en séquence radialement vers l'intérieur et vers l'extérieur lorsque ladite roue (32; 162) tourne autour dudit axe horizontal.

Dispositif selon la revendication 2, dans lequel lesdits moyens (126,128) comprennent au moins une came disposée à proximité de ladite roue (32; 162) pour engager lesdits deuxièmes segments de moule en séquence lorsque ladite roue tourne autour dudit axe.
Dispositif selon la revendication 1, dans lequel ladite roue (32 ou 162) comprend un support s'étendant radialement (46) sur lequel lesdits moules (72; 164) sont montés.
Dispositif selon la revendication 4, dans lequel lesdits moules (72 ou 164) sont montés à proximité d'une périphérie dudit support (46).

Dispositif selon la revendication 5, dans lequel ledit support (46) comporte une multiplicité de poches (49) s'ouvrant radialement vers l'extérieur et angulairement espacées, et dans lequel lesdits deuxièmes segments de moule (78) sont montés sur des barres (50) supportées de façon coulissante dans lesdites poches (49).
Dispositif selon la revendication 4, dans lequel chacun desdits premiers segments de moule (76 ou 166) est monté entre des supports intérieur et extérieur (68, 70) radialement espacés.

Dispositif selon la revendication 7, dans lequel chacun desdits premiers segments de moule (76; 166) est monté de façon coulissante dans ledit support radialement extérieur (70) et est couplé au moyen d'un ressort (108 ou 152) audit support radialement intérieur (68).
Dispositif selon la revendication 8, dans lequel ledit ressort (108; 152) comprend un ressort hélicoïdal ou un ressort à gaz.

Dispositif selon la revendication 1, dans lequel lesdits deuxièmes segments de moule (78) comprennent lesdites alvéoles et lesdits premiers segments de moule (76 ou 166) comprennent lesdits noyaux (80 ou 168).

Dispositif selon la revendication 10, dans lequel ledit dispositif de placement de charges de moule (132) place des charges de moule dans les capsules de fermeture préfabriquées (122) en séquence avant le placement des capsules dans lesdites alvéoles.

Dispositif selon la revendication 11, dans lequel ledit dispositif de placement de charges de moule (132) comprend: - un appareil de placement de charges de moule (150), - une roue de placement (138) pouvant tourner autour d'un axe vertical en synchronisme avec la rotation de ladite roue verticale (32; 162) autour dudit axe horizontal, ladite roue de placement (138) présentant des poches périphériques (140) destinées à recevoir en séquence les capsules de fermeture (122), - un rail de guidage (146) entourant au moins une partie de ladite roue de lacement (138), et - des ressorts (144) sur ladite roue de placement (138) destinés à engager des capsules (122) dans lesdites poches (140) et à pousser les capsules (122) contre ledit rail de guidage (146) afin de localiser les capsules (122) par rapport à l'appareil de placement de charges de moule (150).

Dispositif selon la revendication 12, dans lequel ledit rail de guidage (146) comporte une partie (148) qui est linéaire et tangente audit axe vertical de telle manière que les capsules (122) se déplacent selon un chemin linéaire le long de ladite partie dudit rail de guidage à proximité dudit appareil de placement de charges de moule (150).

Dispositif selon la revendication 12, dans lequel lesdits ressorts (144) engagent des broches (142) portées par ladite roue de placement (138) pour pousser les capsules (122) contre ledit rail de guidage (146).

Dispositif selon la revendication 10, dans lequel ledit dispositif de placement de charges de moule (214) place des charges de moule dans les capsules de fermeture préfabriquées (122) en séquence après le placement des capsules dans lesdites alvéoles.

Dispositif selon la revendication 15, dans lequel ledit dispositif de placement de charges de moule (214) place des charges de moule sur lesdits noyaux (168) en séquence, lesdits noyaux plaçant lesdites charges de moule dans lesdites capsules de fermeture préfabriquées (122) lorsque ledit deuxième segment de moule (78) et ladite alvéole sont fermés contre ledit noyau (168).

Dispositif selon la revendication 16, dans lequel chacun desdits noyaux (168) comprend: - une broche de noyau (170) couplée à ladite roue (162), - un fourreau de noyau (174) entourant ladite broche de noyau, et - un ressort (204) poussant ledit fourreau de noyau radialement vers l'extérieur par rapport à ladite broche de noyau afin de former une poche entre ladite broche de noyau et ledit fourreau de noyau en vue d'y recevoir une charge de moule,
dans lequel la fermeture dudit deuxième segment de moule (78) contre ledit premier segment de moule (166) provoque le déplacement dudit fourreau de noyau (174) contre ledit ressort (204) afin de réduire ladite poche et de mouler par compression ladite charge de moule.
Dispositif selon la revendication 17, comprenant des moyens (194, 196) destinés à diriger un agent de refroidissement à travers ledit fourreau de noyau (174) afin de refroidir ledit noyau (168).

Dispositif selon la revendication 18, dans lequel ledit fourreau de noyau (174) forme une cavité d'agent de refroidissement annulaire (182), dans lequel ledit noyau (168) comprend un manchon intermédiaire (184) positionné de façon à diviser ladite cavité d'agent de refroidissement annulaire (182) en des cavités d'agent de refroidissement annulaires intérieure et extérieure, ledit manchon intermédiaire (184) comportant des passages (198, 200) destinés à conduire l'agent de refroidissement auxdites cavités annulaires intérieure et extérieure.

Dispositif selon la revendication 1, dans lequel chacun desdits noyaux (168) comporte un passage (104) pour l'application d'un vide à un sommet dudit noyau afin d'évacuer l'air pendant le moulage par compression de la charge de moule.

Procédé de moulage par compression de garnitures d'étanchéité à l'intérieur de capsules de fermeture préfabriquées (122), qui comprend les étapes suivantes: (a) procurer une roue (30 ou 160) montée en vue de la rotation autour d'un axe horizontal et une multiplicité de moules (72 ou 164) angulairement espacés disposés autour de ladite roue, chacun desdits moules comprenant un premier segment de moule (76 ou 166) et un deuxième segment de moule (78) disposé radialement à l'extérieur dudit premier segment de moule, (b) faire tourner une roue (30; 60) autour d'un axe horizontal, (c) lorsque ladite roue (30; 60) tourne, déplacer radialement chacun desdits deuxièmes segments de moule (78) en séquence par rapport au premier segment de moule associé (76; 166) entre une position fermée radialement intérieure avec ledit premier segment de moule et une position ouverte radialement extérieure espacée dudit premier segment de moule associé, (d) avec lesdits segments de moule (78, 78; 166) dans ladite position ouverte, enlever une capsule de fermeture (122) avec une garniture moulée par compression hors dudit moule (72; 164), et placer une capsule de fermeture préfabriquée (122) et une charge de moule de matière de garniture dans ledit moule, et (e) fermer lesdits segments de moule (76, 78; 166) lorsque ladite roue (30, 160) tourne pour mouler par compression la charge de moule de matière de garniture entre lesdits segments de moule.

Procédé selon la revendication 21, dans lequel ladite charge de moule de matière de garniture est placée dans les capsules de fermeture préfabriquées (122) dans ladite étape (d) avant le placement des capsules de fermeture dans ledit moule.

Procédé selon la revendication 21, dans lequel la charge de moule de matière de garniture est placée dans la capsule de fermeture préfabriquée (122) dans ladite étape (d) après le placement de la capsule de fermeture dans ledit moule.
